msDesc.head: Ps.-Augustine; Ps.-Albertus Magnus; Petrus Comestor. Germany, s. xivin.

msItem.note: This description is abbreviated from Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue (Oxford, 2018), pp. 728–734. For purposes of scholarly citation, reference to the printed catalogue is requested.

msItem.author: Thomas Aquinas
msItem.title: Commentary on the Sentences
msItem.note: Excerpts (ed.: STO 1 (1989) 546 and 556; Stegmüller, RS, 846; Glorieux, Rép., 14f).

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: De assumptione beatae Mariae
msItem.note: Abridged version (ed.: PL 40. 1143–48; Römer ii/1. 33 (no. 28); ii/2. 275; CPPM 2. 161; CMA Gallia 2. 492f.).

msItem.author: Ps.-Albertus Magnus
msItem.title: De laudibus Mariae
msItem.note: With prologue (ed.: AMO 37 (1898) 1–321; Little 40; Glorieux, Rép., 6a; Grabmann, Geistesleben, 2. 355; Stegmüller, RB, 1061, and suppl., this copy).

msItem.author: Petrus Comestor
msItem.title: De excellentia BMV
msItem.note: Verse in praise of Virgin Mary (ed.: PL 198. 1045C; AH 32. 160, ll. 1– 9).
Excerpts from Thomas Aquinas, Bernard of Clairvaux, Isidore of Seville, Gregory the Great, Augustine, and others.

supportDesc.support: parchment; two binding strips from a document dating from 1421, written in bastarda.
supportDesc.extent: i (17th cent.) + 71 + i (17th cent.) leaves c.230–40 165–70

layoutDesc.layout: Ruling in lead point, two columns of c.37–52 lines. Ruled space c.173–80 122–30

handDesc.handNote: German textualis cursiva, s. xivin, by several hands. Marginalia in contemporary hands and hands of s. xivex and s. xv from the Mainz Charterhouse.

binding.p: Brown reversed calf over laminated pulpboard for Archbp. Laud, 1637–1639

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: Ex-libris inscriptions, dated c.1395-99, at the head of fol. 4r: ‘Iste liber est Carthusiensium prope Magunciam’, fol. 44r: ‘Iste liber est Carthusiensium monasterii sancti michaelis prope magunciam sub Anno domini mo ccco xc[v?; the rest cropped]’, and fol. 70v: ‘Iste liber est Carthusiensium prope magunciam’; all three inscriptions in the same hand.
William Laud, 1573–1645: Ex-libris inscription, dated 1638, at the lower margin of fol. 2r.
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.

recordHist.source: See above. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, col. 193 Quarto Catalogue, p. 553 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 55

listBibl.head: Published descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue, 2 vols. (Oxford, 2018), pp. 728–734

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for Mainz digitization project to include additional information from Mairhofer catalogue.
